script1.segment1: Once upon a time in a small village there lived a boy named Rohan he was very honest always
script1.segment2: One day while playing outside he found a wallet lying on the ground it was very shiny and new
script1.segment3: Rohan picked it up and saw that it was full of money and a identity card he thought
script1.segment4: Whoever this wallet belongs to must be very worried and decided to return it to its owner
script1.segment5: He asked everyone in the village if the wallet belonged to them but no one knew

script2.segment1: Rohan decided to go to the nearby city to find the owner of the wallet he travelled
script2.segment2: A long distance and finally reached the city he asked many people but no one knew
script2.segment3: The owner of the wallet just when he was about to give up he met a old lady
script2.segment4: She was very worried and told Rohan that the wallet belonged to her son who was travelling
script2.segment5: She thanked Rohan for his honesty and gave him a big reward for his kind heart

script3.segment1: The villagers heard about Rohan's honesty and were very impressed they all praised
script3.segment2: Rohan for his good deed and called him a true hero of the village from that day
script3.segment3: Rohan was known as the most honest boy in the village and everyone trusted him
script3.segment4: He proved that honesty is the best policy and it always leads to happiness
script3.segment5: The villagers celebrated his honesty with a big function and Rohan felt very happy

script4.segment1: The story of Rohan spread far and wide and many children heard about it they all
script4.segment2: Were inspired by Rohan's honesty and decided to follow his footsteps
script4.segment3: They learned that honesty is the best policy and it always brings good results
script4.segment4: The children promised to always be honest and make their parents and teachers
script4.segment5: The story of Rohan came to an end but his honesty remained forever in the hearts
